content.rendered:
I’m a portrait photographer based in London (UK), producing high-quality images for clients in the public, private and charity sectors.

My photography focuses on people in creative business and in rights and development; musicians, entrepreneurs, artists, educators working on diversity and inclusion.

I hold a BA (Hons) in Film, Video and Photographic Arts (University of Westminster, UK) and an MA in Journalism (University of Technology, Sydney – Australia). After graduating, I worked and volunteered for several years in non-profit organisations including Peace Brigades International (PBI), with which I spent a year in Guatemala as a human rights observer and more than five years as communications officer in London.

My work has been commissioned by NGOs, corporate and commercial clients, for whom I have produced campaigns and content especially in the music, education and non-profit industries.

I’m interested in working on national and international photographic projects with a positive, empowering slant, documenting the work of NGOs, associations and communities who foster human rights, as well as covering music and arts events with a civil and social element.

I’d love to hear from you – please get in touch!
